metadata.synopsis: When a luxury cruise ship reaches the high seas, its owner (Ian Holm) receives a disturbing phone call from a man known only as Juggernaut (Freddie Jones) : Pay a steep ransom or he will explode the ship. Soon after the demand, explosives expert Lt. Cmdr. Anthony Fallon (Richard Harris) and his squad parachute onto the cruise ship to defuse the rigged time bombs. On land, Superintendent John McLeod (Anthony Hopkins), who has family on board, searches for the terrorist.

reviews: The title doesn't provide any clues -- no, this isn't a movie about the X-Men villain -- but Juggernaut is a nifty British thriller that offers maximum returns on its minimalist approach.

'Juggernaut' is a high level show, a human adventure in which good is represented by perseverance and logic, and evil is the forgetfulness of a country towards a certain class of people. [Full Review in Spanish]
Deceptively casual, yet there's hardly moment when it's not extracting near-perfect details of character and setting.
If you show a ticking bomb, then you'd better blow something up with it
